title: Test Harness Architecture: Prove P2P Connectivity Works
description: Comprehensive test harness redesign to truly verify P2P QUIC connectivity with NAT traversal. Based on Oracle analysis: must prove bidirectional data transfer, correct method attribution (direct vs hole-punched vs relayed), temporal resilience, and network impairment handling.

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Epic Complete: All 11 phases implemented. Total new types: DataProof, SuccessLevel, MethodProof, TestPattern, NetworkProfile, ImpairmentMetrics, TemporalScenario, TemporalMetrics, MigrationMetrics, PathTuple, FailureReasonCode, TestReport, NatScenario, RelayMetrics, TestSuite, TestSuiteConfig. Total tests: 191 (up from 110). All types exported and ready for use.

title: Phase 1: Bidirectional Data Proof for All Successes
description:
CRITICAL: Connection established is NOT enough. Every successful connection MUST prove bidirectional application data transfer.

Requirements:
- A sends test payload → B verifies integrity and replies (not just ACKs)
- B sends test payload → A verifies integrity and replies
- Stream AND datagram semantics tested separately if both supported
- Checksum verification on both ends
- Capture: bytes_sent, bytes_received, checksum_valid, echo_rtt_ms

Success Criteria:
- Level 2 (Usable) requires bidirectional payload exchange
- No success without data proof
- TechniqueAttempt must include payload verification result

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: DataProof struct, SuccessLevel enum, ConnectivityMatrix extensions, 14 new unit tests. Tests verify bidirectional data transfer requirement.

title: Phase 10: Success Level Definitions + Enforcement
description:
Define explicit success levels and require minimum for pass.

Success Levels:
Level 1 - Established (necessary but not sufficient):
  - QUIC handshake completes
  - Peer identity authenticated (ML-KEM/ML-DSA)
  - Connection enters established state

Level 2 - Usable (minimum proof of 'connectivity works'):
  - Bidirectional application data verified
  - Stream and/or datagram semantics work
  - REQUIRED FOR PASS

Level 3 - Sustained (not fragile):
  - Maintain transfer for T seconds under impairment
  - No spurious disconnects or stalled streams

Level 4 - Correct-method (proof technique worked):
  - Direct: no NAT frames, direct address used
  - NAT traversal: negotiation + frames + external mapping
  - Relay: data through relay with evidence
  - REQUIRED FOR PASS

Level 5 - Temporal resilience:
  - Survives idle/expiry
  - Reconnect within SLO

Enforcement:
- Test MUST achieve Level 2 + Level 4 to pass
- Create success_level field in test results
- CI gate on minimum success level

Gap Fixed: 'Connected' is not enough - need explicit success criteria

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: is_fully_passing() requires Level 2 (Usable) + method_proof with sufficient evidence (effectively L2+L4). SuccessLevel enum with L0-L5 levels already implemented in Phase 1. 3 enforcement tests

title: CI Suite Split: Fast vs Deep
description:
Create two test suite configurations for different contexts.

CI-Fast Suite (every PR, ~5min):
- Direct IPv4/IPv6 both public
- Single NAT one side + public
- Single NAT both sides
- Low MTU (1200 bytes)
- Bidirectional data proof
- Method attribution
- A→B and B→A patterns

Nightly-Deep Suite (~30min):
- All CI-Fast tests
- Double NAT, hairpin, CGNAT
- Mobile carrier profiles
- Simultaneous open races
- NAT binding expiry (requires wait)
- Connection migration
- Repeated churn (10+ cycles)
- Full impairment matrix
- Relay fallback scenarios

Implementation:
- Create test profile configs
- Add --profile flag to test runner
- Document which tests in which suite
- Set up CI workflows for each

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: TestSuite enum (CiFast, NightlyDeep, Full), TestSuiteConfig struct with pre-built configurations for each suite level, includes NAT scenarios, test patterns, network profiles, temporal scenarios, migration/relay flags, estimated_pairs() and estimated_duration_secs() methods, 6 tests

title: Phase 2: Method Attribution Correctness
description:
CRITICAL: Must distinguish HOW connection succeeded - direct vs hole-punched vs relayed.

Requirements:
- Track observed 5-tuple/path for each connection
- Record NAT frame exchange evidence (ADD_ADDRESS, OBSERVED_ADDRESS, PUNCH_ME_NOW counts + timestamps)
- Prove direct: no NAT traversal frames needed, directly reachable address used
- Prove NAT traversal: NAT negotiation completed + frames exchanged + external mapping used
- Prove relay: data flows through relay (relay connection IDs, hop evidence)

Implementation:
- Extend ConnectivityMatrix with method_proof field
- Add NAT frame counters per connection
- Record active path tuple changes over time
- Add method_attribution_confidence score

Gap Fixed: Current 'NAT traversal success' could secretly be 'direct succeeded'

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: MethodProof struct with NAT frame counters (ADD_ADDRESS, PUNCH_ME_NOW, OBSERVED_ADDRESS), confidence scoring, sufficient evidence checks, 9 new unit tests. calculate_success_level now reaches Level 4 (CorrectMethod) when method_proof has sufficient evidence.

title: Phase 3: Directionality + Simultaneous Open Tests
description:
Test all connection initiation patterns - A→B alone misses half of real-world failures.

Required Test Patterns (per peer pair):
1. A→B outbound initiation - A initiates, verify bidirectional data
2. B→A outbound initiation - Reversed, catches asymmetric NAT/firewall
3. Simultaneous open (A↔B) - Both initiate within small window
4. Inbound accept under load - Accept while maintaining existing connections

Each pattern must be tested for:
- Direct IPv4/IPv6
- NAT traversal IPv4/IPv6
- Relayed (when implemented)

Implementation:
- Add test_pattern field to PeerConnectivityResult: Outbound, Inbound, Simultaneous
- Create test orchestration for simultaneous open timing
- Track asymmetric failure modes

Gap Fixed: Current tests only do A→B, missing B→A and race conditions

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: TestPattern enum (Outbound, Inbound, Simultaneous, InboundUnderLoad), test_pattern field in ConnectivityMatrix, passes_for_pattern() method, 4 tests

title: Phase 4: Network Impairment Profiles (MTU/Loss/Latency)
description:
PQC handshakes are large - must stress test under real network conditions.

Required Impairment Profiles:
1. Low MTU (1200 bytes) - stress PQC handshake sizing and QUIC PMTU
2. High latency (100-500ms RTT) - realistic WAN conditions
3. Packet loss (1-5%) - test retransmission and congestion control
4. Combined profiles for realism

Metrics to Capture:
- Handshake message sizes / total handshake bytes
- PMTU detection events, blackhole detection
- Fragmentation issues
- Retransmission counts, PTO events
- CPU/wall time in handshake crypto (optional)

Implementation:
- Add network_profile to test config (mtu, latency_ms, loss_percent)
- Use tc/netem or Docker network shaping
- Record impairment-specific failure reasons

Gap Fixed: No systematic stress testing - PQC + QUIC PMTU regressions slip through

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: NetworkProfile struct with 6 presets (ideal, low_mtu, high_latency, lossy, mobile, stressed), ImpairmentMetrics struct for tracking handshake/PMTU/retransmissions, is_impaired() and severity_score() methods, passes_under_impairment() method, 13 tests

title: Phase 5: Temporal Resilience Tests
description:
NAT traversal implementations usually fail under time and state changes.

Required Temporal Scenarios:
1. Cold start - no prior peer knowledge, no cached addresses
2. Warm reconnect - same peers reconnect with cached observations
3. NAT binding expiry test:
   - Hold connection idle past UDP mapping timeout (30-60s typical)
   - Test if keepalives prevent expiry
   - Test reconnection + re-traversal if expiry occurs
4. Repeated churn - N connect/disconnect cycles (catch state leaks)

Metrics:
- idle_duration_before_failure
- keepalive_effectiveness
- reconnect_time_after_expiry
- whether re-hole-punch was required

Success Criteria:
- Level 5 (Temporal resilience): survives time and change
- After idle/expiry: same connection continues OR reconnect within SLO
- N churn cycles complete without degradation

Gap Fixed: Missing NAT binding expiry and reconnect determinism tests

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: TemporalScenario enum (ColdStart, WarmReconnect, NatBindingExpiry, RepeatedChurn), TemporalMetrics struct with idle tracking, keepalive effectiveness, reconnect metrics, churn cycle tracking, is_level5_passing(), 8 tests

title: Phase 6: Connection Migration Tests
description:
QUIC connection migration is a key feature - must verify it works under NAT.

Required Tests:
1. Source IP/port change - move between interfaces
2. NAT rebinding - mapping changes mid-connection
3. Verify connection stays alive after migration
4. Verify data continues to flow on new path
5. Verify path changes are correctly reported

Metrics:
- migration_events_count
- migration_success_rate
- data_continuity_after_migration
- path_tuple_history

Implementation:
- Trigger migration via interface changes or NAT manipulation
- Track PATH_CHALLENGE/PATH_RESPONSE timing
- Verify ConnectivityMatrix.active_method updates correctly

Gap Fixed: No migration testing despite QUIC supporting it

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: MigrationMetrics struct with migration attempt/success tracking, PATH_CHALLENGE/PATH_RESPONSE counts, PathTuple for path history, migration_success_rate() and path_validation_rate() methods, 5 tests

title: Phase 7: NAT Scenario Matrix Expansion
description:
Current NAT coverage is basic - need comprehensive real-world scenarios.

MUST Baseline (CI-fast):
- No NAT / public IP both sides (control)
- Single NAT (Port-Restricted/Symmetric) one side, public other
- Single NAT both sides (core NAT traversal claim)
- CGNAT-like behavior (very common real-world)
- Low MTU path (1200 bytes)

SHOULD Expand (nightly-deep):
- Double NAT (home router behind ISP NAT)
- Hairpin NAT (peer behind same NAT connects via external mapping)
- NAT rebinding (mapping changes mid-connection)
- Mobile carrier NAT / 464XLAT-ish
- IPv6-only + NAT64 environments

Implementation:
- Create NAT emulator profiles for each scenario
- Explicit mapping/expiry controls per profile
- Packet capture at namespace boundaries for debugging

Gap Fixed: Missing double NAT, hairpin, mobile carrier patterns

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: NatScenario enum with 10 scenarios (BothPublic, SingleNatOnePublic, SingleNatBoth, Cgnat, DoubleNat, Hairpin, NatRebinding, MobileCarrier, Ipv6OnlyNat64, SymmetricBoth), is_ci_fast(), requires_relay(), expected_difficulty() methods, 5 tests

title: Phase 8: Relay Fallback Implementation + Testing
description:
Relay is TODO in current code - must be first-class tested.

Requirements:
- Relay must be distinguishable from direct/hole-punched
- Prove data flows THROUGH relay (relay path markers, connection IDs, hop evidence)
- Test relay fallback policy: direct → hole-punch → relay
- Verify relay works when direct + hole-punch fail

Test Scenarios:
- Symmetric NAT to Symmetric NAT (relay only option)
- Double NAT scenarios
- Explicit relay-only mode for testing

Metrics:
- relay_hop_count
- relay_latency_overhead
- relay_throughput
- fallback_sequence (what was tried before relay)

Gap Fixed: 'Relay is TODO' - connectivity guarantee incomplete without it

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: RelayMetrics struct with relay peer/addr tracking, fallback sequence recording, is_relay_proven() method, integrates with MethodProof for relay evidence, 4 tests

title: Phase 9: Structured Reporting + Failure Codes
description:
Make test output actionable for CI, dashboards, and debugging.

Report Structure (3 consumers):
1. Human summary (CI logs): pass/fail, rates per technique, p50/p95 latencies, top failure reasons
2. Per-pair detail: tested patterns, method attempts, data proof, active paths
3. Attempt timeline: phase transitions, failure_reason_code, key events

Required Fields:
- Stable failure_reason_code enum (not just strings)
- failure_reason_detail for debugging
- Key events: 'observed address learned', 'punch requested', 'path validated', 'stream echo ok'

JSON Artifact:
- run_id, git_sha, topology, nat_profiles, mtu, impairments
- pairs[] with attempts and metrics
- aggregates with pass rates and latency percentiles

Implementation:
- Define FailureReasonCode enum
- Extend TechniqueAttempt with failure codes
- Create JSON report emitter
- Create human-readable summary formatter

Gap Fixed: Reporting not normalized - failures hard to trend and fix

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: FailureReasonCode enum with 23 variants (stable codes), is_recoverable() and is_configuration_issue() helpers, TestReport struct with run metadata, pair results, failure breakdown, latency percentiles, top_failures() and human_summary(), 10 tests

title: Project: Comprehensive P2P Testing Framework
Epic 1: Foundation & Result Schema
close_reason: Closed

title: Define AttemptResult schema (run_id, scenario_id, dimensions, outcome, telemetry)
description: Core result schema for all test types. Includes: run_id (UUID), scenario_id, attempt_id, timestamp, NAT dimensions (nat_a, nat_b, ip_mode), outcome (success, path_used, connect_time_ms, error), and telemetry (frames_sent, frames_recv). Must support JSONL serialization and Prometheus export.
close_reason: Implemented AttemptResult schema with all dimensions, proofs, and telemetry

title: Define failure taxonomy (Harness vs SUT vs Infrastructure)
description: Strict failure classification: HarnessPreflightError, HarnessOrchestrationError, HarnessObservationError, SUTConnectivityFailure, SUTBehaviorMismatch, InfrastructureFlake. Rule: if cannot prove test ran as intended, it is a harness problem.
close_reason: Implemented FailureCategory enum with Harness/SUT/Infrastructure classification

title: Implement test-agent HTTP API (start/stop/status/results/profile)
description: HTTP API for test agent: POST /run/start, POST /run/{id}/stop, GET /run/{id}/status, GET /run/{id}/results (JSONL stream), POST /node/profile (apply NAT simulation). Include version/capabilities handshake.
close_reason: Implemented agent HTTP API types and endpoints

title: Implement saorsa-testctl orchestrator binary
description: CLI tool that: discovers agents via registry/DNS, plans scenario execution, coordinates distributed runs, aggregates results, generates reports. Scenario types: connectivity_matrix, gossip_workflow, chaos_gossip, perf_baseline.
close_reason: Closed

title: Define artifact manifest schema (logs, pcaps, state dumps, checksums)
description: Every test attempt produces: agent logs, SUT logs (ant-quic/saorsa-gossip), pcaps from capture window, NAT state (iptables-save, conntrack -L), process state dumps (pid list, open sockets, routes). All with SHA256 checksums.
close_reason: Implemented ArtifactManifest with checksums and required types

title: Implement scenario spec format (YAML/JSON with NAT profiles, topologies, thresholds)
description: Committed scenario definitions: NAT behavior profiles, topology configs, attempt counts, time budgets, success thresholds. Deterministic with explicit seeds.
close_reason: Implemented ScenarioSpec with topology, thresholds, timing

title: Epic 2: Harness Validation Loop (Measure→Debug→Fix→Test→Deploy)
MEASURE: Define harness correctness metrics (completion, determinism, artifact integrity)
description: Metrics: run completeness %, stage health (time/timeouts), agent health (heartbeat, resource stats), artifact integrity (manifest + checksums), determinism score (same inputs → same classification). Distinguish harness bugs from SUT failures.
close_reason: Closed

title: TEST: Define oracle test suite (known-good and known-bad scenarios)
description: Oracle tests with known outcomes: OracleSuccess-Loopback, OracleSuccess-DualStack, OracleFail-UDPBlocked, OracleRelay-Forced, OracleFail-VersionMismatch, OracleFail-ArtifactMissing. Fast (<30s), repeatable (0% flake), diagnostically rich.
close_reason: Closed

title: TEST: Implement chaos injection into harness itself
description: Test harness resilience: kill agent mid-attempt, delay artifact uploads, corrupt artifacts, partition control-plane from data-plane. Verify taxonomy holds and failures are correctly classified.

title: DEPLOY: Implement canary deployment strategy (stable vs canary pools)
description: Maintain agent pools: stable (production harness), canary (new harness). Run same oracle suite on both pools hourly. Compare completion rate, artifact completeness, classification stability.

title: DEPLOY: Implement rollback procedure with version pinning
description: Keep last-known-good binaries cached on each VPS. Rollback is first-class command: stop agents, deploy pinned version, verify via oracle suite. Handle schema migrations for old results.

title: VALIDATION: Achieve 25% confidence - harness self-tests pass, schema stable
description: Milestone: harness self-tests + fake-agent simulator pass. Result schema stable. Replay mode works. No real network required yet.

title: VALIDATION: Achieve 50% confidence - oracle suite passes with 0% flake locally
description: Milestone: 5-10 oracle scenarios pass with ~0% flake on single environment (local or CI). Artifacts always complete. Every failure classifiable.

title: VALIDATION: Achieve 75% confidence - Docker NAT + VPS canary stable
description: Milestone: Docker NAT emulation + small VPS canary runs stable. Failures correctly classified. Rollbacks proven to work.

title: VALIDATION: Achieve 100% confidence - full matrix, independent validation, <0.1% unexplained failures
description: Milestone: Independent validation exists. Oracle suite stable over 7 days (<0.1% unexplained failures). Full-matrix results show low unexplained-failure rate. Every failure has evidence for categorization.

title: MEASURE: Establish baseline measurements (env fingerprint, golden runs)
description: Per-agent fingerprint: OS/kernel, NICs, IPv4/IPv6, NAT rules version, clock offset, binary versions. Golden run on no-NAT same-L2 (should be ~100% success). Known-bad run with UDP blocked (should fail consistently).
close_reason: Closed

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: Created baseline.rs with EnvironmentFingerprint, GoldenRunBaseline, drift detection. 30 tests passing.

title: DEBUG: Implement structured logging with run/test/agent correlation
description: Every log includes: run_id, test_id, agent_id, role, monotonic timestamp. Stage boundary events mandatory: PreflightStarted/Ok, ConfigApplied, ProcessesStarted, BarrierReached, AttemptStarted/Ended, ArtifactsUploaded.
close_reason: Closed

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: Created structured_logging.rs with LogContext, StructuredLogEntry, LogBatch, LogAggregator. 46 tests passing.

title: DEBUG: Implement debug bundle collection (pcaps, conntrack, docker logs)
description: For each attempt: agent/ctl/SUT logs, pcaps from capture window, NAT state (iptables-save, conntrack -L), Docker container logs, process state dumps (pid list, sockets, routes), metrics snapshot. All with manifest + checksums.
close_reason: Closed

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: Created debug_bundle.rs with DebugArtifact, CollectionRequest, BundleManifest, DebugBundle. 40 tests passing.

title: DEBUG: Implement replay mode (re-run classification from artifacts)
description: Given past run manifest + artifacts, re-run only classification and report generation. Must produce identical results. Enables classifier iteration without re-running network tests.
close_reason: Closed

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: Created replay_mode.rs with ReplaySession, ReplaySource, ReplayEvent, ClassificationResult, ClassificationComparison. 41 tests passing.

title: FIX: Implement idempotent run recovery (checkpoint/resume)
description: If run crashes mid-way, rerun resumes from checkpoints. Detect 'attempt N started but no terminal state'. Ensure harness never leaves partial state that corrupts subsequent runs.
close_reason: Closed

comments.author: davidirvine
comments.text: Completed: Created run_recovery.rs with RunStage, Checkpoint, CheckpointData, RunRecoveryManager, RecoveryConfig. 41 tests passing.

title: FIX: Implement version compatibility handshake (ctl↔agent)
description: Session start capabilities handshake: protocol version, supported artifact types, supported NAT profiles. Enforce mixed-version safety: allow rolling upgrades, guaranteed rollback. Refuse incompatible versions.
close_reason: Closed

title: FIX: Create golden fixture tests (schema stability, classifier stability)
description: Store representative manifests + artifacts. Run classifier against golden fixtures and verify output is stable across harness versions. Catches regressions in result interpretation.
close_reason: Closed

title: TEST: Implement harness self-test suite (fake agents, simulator, no QUIC)
description: Meta-tests with no real network: state machine property tests (no deadlocks, bounded retries), classifier tests (synthetic timelines → correct classification), artifact contract tests (manifest always complete).
close_reason: Closed

title: Epic 3: Connectivity Matrix Testing (225 Combinations)
Define NAT behavior profiles (EIM/EIF, ADF, APDF, APDM combinations)
description: Model NAT as behavior profiles: Mapping (EIM/ADM/APDM), Filtering (EIF/ADF/APDF), Hairpinning, Port preservation, State timeouts. Map to types: Full Cone, Restricted, Port-Restricted, Symmetric, CGNAT.

title: Implement Docker NAT simulation profiles (iptables/tc rules)
description: Docker containers with iptables rules for each NAT type. Full Cone: MASQUERADE --random + ACCEPT. Symmetric: MASQUERADE --random-fully + state ESTABLISHED only. Include tc netem for loss/latency.

title: Implement IP mode testing (IPv4-only, IPv6-only, dual-stack)
description: Test all three modes: IPv4 bind only, IPv6 bind only, dual-stack with v4-mapped-v6 handling. Verify external address discovery works in each mode.

title: Implement connection path classification (Direct, Punch, Relay)
description: Instrument connections to classify path used: Direct (no NAT frames), Punch (ADD_ADDRESS/OBSERVED_ADDRESS/PUNCH_ME_NOW observed), Relay (explicit relay fallback). Track % usage per NAT pair.

title: Deploy VPS test agents (saorsa-2 through saorsa-5)
description: Deploy test-agent to VPS fleet: saorsa-2 (coordinator, no NAT), saorsa-3/4/5 (various NAT simulations). Configure IPv4+IPv6 where available.

title: Build connectivity matrix runner (25 NAT pairs × 3 IP modes × 3 paths)
description: Matrix runner in testctl: iterate all 225 combinations, run N attempts per cell, collect results, compute success rates. Support subset mode for faster iteration.

title: Define success criteria (≥99% direct, ≥95% punch, ≥80% hard NAT)
description: Per-cell thresholds: success_rate over N≥100 attempts. Direct pairs: ≥99%. Punch pairs: ≥95%. Hard NAT (Symmetric↔Symmetric, CGNAT): ≥80%. Track p95 connect times per path type.

title: Generate connectivity matrix report (HTML/JSON with heatmap)
description: Visual report: 5×5 NAT heatmap colored by success rate, breakdown by IP mode and path, trend over time, regression alerts. Export as HTML and JSON.

title: Implement local node integration (home NAT testing)
description: Allow local machine to join test runs as a node. Auto-detect local NAT type via behavioral classification. Test local↔VPS connectivity across all paths.

title: Epic 4: Gossip Crate Coverage (12 Crates)
saorsa-gossip-types: Wire format roundtrips, ID determinism, max-size handling
description: Property tests: serde/bincode/varint roundtrips, version compat, fuzzing. PeerId/TopicId determinism, display/parse, hashing/equality. MessageHeader calculation. CBOR wire format.

title: saorsa-gossip-crdt-sync: OR-Set, LWW-Register, delta merge, anti-entropy
description: Unit: OR-Set add/remove, LWW-Register causality. Property: delta idempotent/associative/commutative. Chaos: convergence under partition. Performance: delta-based sync bandwidth efficient.

title: saorsa-gossip-simulator: Determinism, chaos event types, time dilation
description: Unit: same seed → same outcomes. Integration: all ChaosEvent types work (partition, loss, latency, node failure). Time dilation correctness for accelerated testing.

title: saorsa-gossip-load-test: Throughput baseline, latency baseline, soak test
description: Performance baselines: messages/sec target, p50/p95/p99 latency within budget. Soak test: 1-hour run without degradation. Regression thresholds for CI gating.

title: Chaos integration: CRDT convergence under partition
description: Full scenario: 3+ replicas, partition into groups, concurrent updates, heal partition, verify eventual consistency. Uses simulator + real CRDT code.

title: Chaos integration: Membership convergence under node churn
description: Full scenario: 5+ nodes, random join/leave churn, verify HyParView views converge, SWIM detects failures correctly. Measure convergence time and false positives.

title: Chaos integration: Combined multi-failure scenario (partition + loss + latency + churn)
description: Extreme chaos: 10 nodes, concurrent network partition, 20% message loss, 300ms latency spike, node failures. Verify system remains operational, state converges after chaos ends.

title: saorsa-gossip-identity: ML-DSA-65 keygen, sign, verify, serialization
description: Unit tests: keygen determinism with seed, sign/verify correctness, invalid signature rejection. Integration: identity mismatch causes connection rejection. Serialization stability across versions.

title: saorsa-gossip-transport: QUIC streams, backpressure, reconnection
description: Integration tests: all 3 stream types work (membership, pubsub, bulk). Load tests: membership doesn't starve pubsub. Chaos tests: mid-stream disconnect recovery, ordering guarantees.

title: saorsa-gossip-membership: HyParView join/shuffle, SWIM failure detection
description: Unit tests: degree bounds (8-12 active, 64-128 passive). Integration: join via seeds, shuffle diversity. SWIM: Alive→Suspect→Dead transitions, false positives under loss. Chaos: partition heal, view repair.

title: saorsa-gossip-pubsub: Plumtree EAGER/IHAVE/IWANT, tree reshaping
description: Integration: EAGER dissemination correctness, IHAVE/IWANT lazy repair on loss. Property tests: bounded duplicates under churn. Chaos: tree reshapes under partitions, no stuck topics.

title: saorsa-gossip-coordinator: Bootstrap, address reflection, relay, rate limiting
description: Integration: new peer discovers network via coordinator. Address reflection works correctly. Relay fallback functions. Security: bogus address claims rejected, rate limits for coordination requests.

title: saorsa-gossip-rendezvous: k=16 sharding, provider publish, query under churn
description: Unit: deterministic shard mapping with BLAKE3. Integration: provider publish reaches shard, query finds providers. Chaos: membership changes don't cause hotspots, graceful degradation under outages.

title: saorsa-gossip-groups: MLS key derivation, member changes, epoch handling
description: Unit: same transcript → same derived keys (BLAKE3 KDF). Integration: member add/remove rotates keys correctly. Property: epoch handling under reordering. Security: replay protection for group messages.

title: saorsa-gossip-presence: Beacon broadcast, FOAF query, TTL expiry
description: Integration: beacons reach group members, FOAF queries work under churn. Unit: TTL expiry removes stale presence. Security: privacy invariants, no unnecessary linkage.

title: Epic 5: User Probe App (saorsa-probe)
Implement saorsa-probe binary skeleton (CLI + TUI)
description: Cross-platform binary with CLI and TUI modes. CLI for scripted usage, TUI for interactive diagnostics. Use ratatui for TUI.

title: Implement NAT classification via behavioral observation
description: Connect to 3+ geographically distributed test nodes. Each reports OBSERVED_ADDRESS. Classify NAT type from observations: same IP:port → Full Cone, same IP/different ports → varies, different IPs → CGNAT/multi-homed.

title: Implement connectivity test suite (connect to public test nodes)
description: Connect to 2-3 VPS test nodes. Record: path used (direct/punch/relay), success/failure, connect time, IPv4/IPv6 availability. Display results in TUI.

title: Implement gossip protocol diagnostics
description: Join test gossip network. Verify: membership (join network, count active peers), pubsub (receive test messages), CRDT (converge with network state). Report success/failure for each.

title: Implement diagnostic bundle generation (local JSON report)
description: Bundle: external addresses, local bind addresses, MTU guess, packet loss estimate, NAT mapping lifetime estimate. Output as JSON file for offline analysis.

title: Implement anonymous result upload with privacy controls
description: Upload results to collection endpoint. Privacy: rotate ephemeral run IDs, hash IPs with daily salt server-side, never upload raw local network details by default. User opt-in for detailed sharing.

title: Implement TUI dashboard (NAT info, connectivity results, gossip status)
description: TUI panels: NAT Classification, External Address, IPv4/IPv6 status, Connectivity Tests (per-node status, path, latency), Gossip Tests (membership, pubsub, CRDT). Interactive commands: Share, Run Again, Quit.

title: Cross-platform builds (macOS, Linux, Windows)
description: GitHub Actions workflow to build saorsa-probe for: macOS (x86_64, aarch64), Linux (x86_64, aarch64), Windows (x86_64). Pre-built binaries on releases page.

title: Epic 6: CI/CD Integration & Production Readiness
PR CI tier: Unit + property tests + simulator-based gossip (~5 min)
description: Every PR: unit tests, property tests (frames/crypto/types), simulator-based gossip workflows + chaos (seeded), small in-process transport integration suite. Target: <5 minutes.

title: Nightly CI tier: Docker NAT matrix + performance baselines (~30 min)
description: Daily at 3 AM: Docker NAT subset matrix (symmetric↔symmetric, cgnat↔*, v6-only - most failure-prone cells). Performance smoke baselines (non-flaky metrics only). Target: <30 minutes.

title: Testnet tier: Full distributed VPS runs (weekly/manual, ~2 hours)
description: workflow_dispatch triggers testctl against VPS agents. Full 225-combination matrix with N=100 attempts. Gate on trend regressions and catastrophic drops, not single-run flakes.

title: Implement statistical pass criteria (success_rate + confidence, not single attempts)
description: Never gate on single attempt. Gate on success_rate + confidence (N attempts). Keep expected flaky scenarios but track them; promote to gates when stable. Flake rate metric per scenario.

title: Set up Prometheus metrics collection + Grafana dashboards
description: Connectivity metrics: connect_success_rate, connect_time_ms p50/p95/p99, %relay_used. Gossip metrics: dissemination latency, delivery ratio, duplicate ratio, membership convergence time.

title: Implement trend analysis and regression detection
description: Track metrics over time. Detect: success rate drift, latency regression, path usage shifts. Alert on significant regressions. Store artifacts for postmortems.

title: GitHub Actions workflow: three-tier testing with gates
description: Complete workflow: PR tier (on pull_request), Nightly tier (on schedule), Testnet tier (on workflow_dispatch). Each tier with appropriate gates and timeout handling.

title: Artifact storage and retention (S3/local, JSONL + compressed logs)
description: Store per-run artifacts: attempt logs, summary JSON, pcaps (compressed). Retention policy: 7 days for PR runs, 30 days for nightly, 90 days for testnet. S3 or local filesystem.
